class.screen: create type vspx_text under vspx_field as ( tf_default varchar default '', -- default value tf_style int default 0 -- 0 is text, 1 is password, 2 is hidden ) temporary self as ref overriding method vc_render () returns any, overriding method vc_set_view_state (e vspx_event) returns any, constructor method vspx_text (name varchar, parent vspx_control), constructor method vspx_text (name varchar, def varchar, pass int, parent vspx_control) ;

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: vspx_textText input, with scripts and validation options but no implied database binding. String input of the HTML form.

refsect2.title: name
refsect2.para: A unique name identifying the control.

refsect2.title: initial-enable
refsect2.para: Designates is control visible or not initially. Could be data-bound to an SQL expression.

refsect2.title: default
refsect2.para: The default value of input field.

refsect2.title: value
refsect2.para: Data bindable value of control, represents value of HTML control to be drawn.

refsect2.title: style
refsect2.para: The style modifier: can be 'password' or 'hidden'. This allows to render it as password input or a hidden field. If isn't specified the visible input will be drawn.

refsect2.title: validator
refsect2.para: validator that is applied to user input. the validator objects are invoked when the element's control gets posted. the validator elements only make sense inside field or form types of controls. the validators are invoked in the order given, and the first one to fail stops the invocation chain, so that no later ones are attempted. furthermore the vc_is_valid member of the containing page class will be reset to false (0) to stop further processing. see also error-summary element and error-glyph attribute of field element.
